p: 1. The paper focuses on HIV prevalence among young adults, with the claim that young adults represent more recent infection and that high prevalence locations can be prioritized for prevention interventions. This is an interesting focus and could be developed further in the paper. Are the locations of high HIV prevalence in young adults the same as the locations among the general adult population? How do areas of high prevalence among young adults compare with variation in the underlying population age structure? More can be said in the discussion about efforts to prevent HIV infection specifically in this age group.
